DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Radiation Field Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a person has a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured for response in an area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Radiation Field Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured for response in an area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Measurable_Disease Radiation Field Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If yes, does the patient have
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, does the patient have disease in an irradiated field as the only site of measurable disease and has progression been documented or a biopsy obtained to confirm persistent disease at least 90 days following completion of radiation treatment?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
